context: I was disrespectful to your friends or family
letters:
I want to take a moment to express how truly sorry I am for my behavior the other day. I know that I was disrespectful to your friends and family, and it pains me to think that I caused you discomfort or embarrassment.

You deserve to be surrounded by people who lift you up, and by acting the way I did, I let both you and your loved ones down. I realize how important those relationships are to you, and I regret not showing the respect they deserve. I take full responsibility for my words and actions in that moment, and I can only imagine how you felt watching it all unfold.

Please know that this was never my intention. You mean the world to me, and I care deeply about the people who matter to you. I have reflected a lot since then, and I am committed to being more mindful of how I express myself, especially in social settings. I want to learn from this and grow, not just for myself, but for us.

I hope you can find it in your heart to forgive me. I value our relationship immensely, and I’m willing to put in the effort to rebuild any trust that may have been shaken. If you're open to it, I’d love a chance to make it up to you and to your friends and family.

Thank you for your understanding and patience. I love you, and I promise to do better moving forward.
